summary: Feature request to replace the workDir parameter with a utility function and switch to using nodeModulesPaths array for webpack configuration in the TypeScript SDK Worker. The discussion explores better approaches for resolving workflow and module paths.
userImpact: Users need a clearer, more intuitive API for specifying workflow and node_modules paths when creating workers.
rootCause: Current workDir and nodeModulesPath parameters are not intuitive; using require.resolve() would be more ergonomic
proposedFix: Use require.resolve('./workflows') to resolve workflow paths instead of manual workDir specification
workaround: Users can manually specify nodeModulesPath as an absolute path if the default resolution doesn't work
resolutionDetails: The team converged on using require.resolve() for path resolution, which is simpler than adding utility functions
keyQuote: even better IMHO: Worker.create({ workflowsPath: require.resolve('./workflows'), activities, taskQueue: 'test' })
